main event: On November 20, 1957, a round object alternating orange, red, and white colors was sighted at Roanoke Rapids AFS, NC. It hovered for 15 minutes before disappearing in a northerly direction.
interesting points: The object was in sight for 15 minutes, allowing for a prolonged observation.
It was described as a round object with alternating orange, red, and white colors, indicating a unique and unusual appearance.
The source of the report was the 1314th AACS, adding credibility to the observation.
It was noted that the description, duration, and characteristics of the sighting matched previous sightings, implying a history of similar observations.
The document contains hand-drawn diagrams and annotations related to the sighting, suggesting further details and analysis.
sighted object: one round object alternating orange, red, and white colors
